post.body: Hi there! Testing ZeroID. Check my ZeroNet-site: http://127.0.0.1:43110/sands.bit
Playing "The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild" on #Nintendo Switch.
Realtime procedural graphics coded by me. The size of exe file is just 4 kilobytes. It's #demoscene! Youtube and download links: http://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=71630
Another demo coded by me and ivanq@zeroid.bit on retro PDP-11 compatible computer http://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=78066
@nofish ZeroNet 6.2 say it's "Up to date!", which is confusing (huge UX issue!). Is it possible to display correct information there?
512 bites intro coded by me for BK 0011m home computer (PDP-11 compatible, designed in 1983 in USSR): https://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=83523
I portet "Da Vinci code: Mona Lisa" to Soyuz-Neon PK-11/16 Soviet home computer. 498 bytes file size.

After 3 days of research and optimization I learned zen of complex numbers field and made this 492-byte intro on Союз-Неон ПК-11/16 - PDP-11 home computer from 1990. It runs pretty fast for such slow computer.
Download exe and source code: https://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=86969
I made the new video game called "PONG Charged" for BK0010 home computer. Executable file, source code and youtube link can be found here: https://www.pouet.net/prod.php?which=87745

comment.body: У России особый путь!... Хотя, постойте - просто копировать с Китая и США всё самое худшее.
